groom.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: someone whose job is to feed, clean, and take care of horses
groom.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to clean and brush an animal, especially a horse
groom.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to prepare someone for an important job or position in society by training them over a long period
groom.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Tim was being groomed for a managerial position.
Clare’s been groomed to take her father’s place when he retires.
groom.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to take care of your own appearance by keeping your hair and clothes clean and tidy
groom.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Her hair is always perfectly groomed.
groom.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to develop a friendship with a child, with the intention of starting a sexual relationship. This is done by adults, and is illegal when the child is younger than 16.
groom.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: if an animal grooms itself or another animal, it cleans its own fur and skin or that of the other animal
